ns4:runnableItem.ns4:description: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?> <microhtml xmlns:ns2="bibiserv:de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.cms.minihtml" xmlns="bibiserv:de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.cms.microhtml">The Input sequence has to be in GDE-Format. The sequence will be the basis for primer calculation. </microhtml>
ns4:runnableItem.ns4:customContent: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?> <ns2:minihtml xmlns:ns2="bibiserv:de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.cms.minihtml" xmlns:ns3="bibiserv:de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.cms.microhtml">GeneFisher -A tool <ns3:em> for </ns3:em>the calculation of degenerate primers</ns2:minihtml>

ns4:manual.ns4:introductoryText: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?> <ns2:minihtml xmlns:ns2="bibiserv:de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.cms.minihtml" xmlns:ns3="bibiserv:de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.cms.microhtml">Genefisher is a tool supporting biologists finding primers for degenerated sequences. Design of degenerated Primers is a feasable task that hardly can be handled manually. </ns2:minihtml>
ns4:manual.ns4:customContent: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?> <ns2:minihtml xmlns:ns2="bibiserv:de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.cms.minihtml" xmlns:ns3="bibiserv:de.unibi.techfak.bibiserv.cms.microhtml">Genefisher is a Toolchain. At the end of the chain there is the primer calculation process. The chain allows the Lab-Worker to enter a number of different sequence-types like protein or nucleotide, single or multiple sequences. </ns2:minihtml>
